title: Single-admin mode UI adjustments for Admin Access Management

requirements.summary: Update /admin/access to reflect single-admin mode by removing admin add/remove actions and showing an English explanation that admin access is locked to the owner principal.
acceptanceCriteria: On /admin/access, the UI does not allow submitting the add-admin form and does not allow triggering remove-admin for any entry.
The page shows a clear English notice that single-admin mode is enabled and only the owner principal can be an admin.
The current admins list renders and shows exactly one admin entry (the owner principal) when listAdmins returns one principal.

file_operations.description: Adjust the Admin Access Management page to match single-admin mode: remove (or fully disable) the "Add New Admin" section and any calls to add-admin mutations; remove (or fully disable) the "Remove Administrator" action and confirmation dialog so removal cannot be triggered for any listed admin; add a clear English notice near the top of the page stating that single-admin mode is enabled and admin access is locked to the owner principal. Reference the owner principal from the existing frontend owner configuration (frontend/src/config/owner.ts) so the notice can display the exact owner principal string.
